contentrichtext.text: {{infobox UK place| | country = England | latitude = 52.391 | longitude = -1.878 | official_name = Hollywood | population = 4,279 | population_ref = <ref>{{cite web|url=http://neighbourhood.statistics.gov.uk/dissemination/LeadKeyFigures.do?a=7&b=6098551&c=Hollywood+and+Majors+Green&d=14&e=15&g=498980&i=1001x1003x1004&m=0&r=1&s=1248819156281&enc=1|title=Key Figures for 2001 Census: Key Statistics|accessdate=28 July 2009}}</ref><br/><small>''Hollywood and Majors Green''</small> | static_image = [[File:Douglas Road, Hollywood - geograph.org.uk - 175732.jpg|250px|]] | static_image_caption = Douglas Road | shire_district = [[Bromsgrove (district)|Bromsgrove]] | shire_county = [[Worcestershire]] | region = West Midlands | civil_parish = Wythall | constituency_westminster = | postcode_district = B47 | postcode_area = B | post_town = BIRMINGHAM | dial_code = 0121 | os_grid_reference = SP081772 | london_distance = }} '''Hollywood''' is a village in the [[Bromsgrove (district)|Bromsgrove district]] of [[Worcestershire]], England, contiguous with and to the south of the city of [[Birmingham]]. The village lies within the ward of Hollywood and Majors Green<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nomisweb.co.uk/reports/lmp/ward/1308627198/report.aspx |title=Office for National Statistics ward maps: Hollywood |format= |date= |accessdate=2012-08-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worcestershire.gov.uk/cms/pdf/Census_Wards_BardsBromsHollywood.pdf |title=Worcestershire County Council Ward Profile |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2010-03-21}}</ref> and is located within the civil parish of [[Wythall]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worcestershire.gov.uk/cms/images/Census_OldParish_Wythall.jpg |title=Worcestershire County Council Historic Parish Maps: Wythall|format=JPG |date= |accessdate=2012-08-04}}</ref> The eastern part of the village is also known as Trueman's Heath. ==History== Until the 1950s, Hollywood was a rural area with many fields and farms. Extensive postwar development saw these fields and farms give way to housing estates, shops and schools. ==Geography== Hollywood is served by the [[A435 road|A435 Alcester Road]], and is adjacent to [[Highter's Heath]] to the north and Drakes Cross to the south. Other settlements close by include [[Wythall]], [[Kings Heath]], [[Kings Norton]], [[Shirley, West Midlands|Shirley]] and [[Dickens Heath]]. ==Amenities== <!-- Given the size of this section, I have opted to use a catch all Amenities term, rather than separate headings for schools etc. When expanded it should follow [[Wikipedia:WikiProject UK geography/How to write about settlements]] --> Hollywood is home to the Gay Hill Golf Club, which has existed since 1921, and a family owned and managed packaging company, [http://www.kilby.co.uk/ Kilby Packaging], which has existed since 1946. The village is served by several schools located immediately outside the ward boundary - Hollywood Primary School is located over the county border within the Highter's Heath area of the city of Birmingham, whilst the Coppice Primary School and Woodrush High School are just within the Drakes Cross ward.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nomisweb.co.uk/reports/lmp/ward/1308627194/report.aspx |title=Office for National Statistics ward maps: Drakes Cross |format= |date= |accessdate=2012-08-04}}</ref> ==Notable residents== *[[John Taylor (bass guitarist)|John Taylor]] from the band [[Duran Duran]]. *[[Alan Dedicoat]] voice of the Balls on [[The National Lottery]]. *[[Alan Smith (footballer born 1962)|Alan Smith]] former [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] striker. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Commons category}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{Bromsgrove}} [[Category:Villages in Worcestershire]] {{Worcestershire-geo-stub}}
